author: Mum0000
title: great service provision
body:
My daughter ended up with an unplanned pregnancy. A decision was made by my daughter and as a family the most appropriate route to take was a medical abortion. The support and care we received from our GP, BPAS call handler, and South Eastern HSC Trust was above and beyond. When it feels like your world is crashing down around you, it was a relief to know we had these services in Northern Ireland and didn‚Äôt have the added stress of having to travel to England.  
The aftercare from South Eastern HSC Trust was excellent. When worried the procedure may have not have been going as planned, a text messaging service was available to get in contact and they were very quick to respond. The nurse may have got more than she bargained for with me, as mother I was not coping emotionally well with the situation and time was taken to talk to me and reassure me. I will be forever grateful for that conversation we had that day.  
I hope these services continue in Northern Ireland and get the appropriate funding. Nobody takes these decisions lightly but when they do, they should be able to avail of these services here.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Fantastic service all round
body:
I've happened to need to visit the GP a few times in December both for myself and my kids. The entire surgery from start to finish is fantastic. The online booking app for same day appointments is great, the doctor who calls you is so patient and helpful. If needed, you can get a same day in person appointment with the same doctor. The receptionists are lovely and helpful on the phone and in person. The doctors and nurses I've seen always listen, empathise, answer all my questions and leave me feeling comfortable and looked after, with great advice / treatment. They're brilliant with my kids, every time. The referrals onto other services are always timely and reliable. The prescription service to deliver to the local pharmacy is brilliant. The surgery is always clean and feels very safe.

A fantastic example of brilliant systems, processes and, most importantly, brilliant people in every case. 

Thank you for being there when I needed you. I'm so grateful for everything you all do.

title: very clean great treatment
body: had arthroscopy as a day case.  Everyone was extremely welcoming right from the receptionist to the nursing staff.  Every thing was explained very well and I felt very safe and cared for.  Even the food and drinks were excellent.  I would recommend this hospital highly

title: Excellent practice
body: I am a carer for my father who has dementia as well as other problems,I use the ask my GP service for the surgery and always get a prompt reply,if the staff have to telephone me they are always patient and understanding, and always solve the problems.

title: First class service
body:
I had an appointment this morning for a blood test and blood pressure check- the receptionists were helpful, friendly and efficient and the assistant that dealt with me was first class and a credit to the practice. 
The attention and service I received was faultless. I have only been with this practice for two years but have always been delighted with the service provided and the friendly staff - thank you.

title: Excellent GP surgery
body:
I am a patient of this surgery over ten years I have always received excellent üëç patient care from this surgery. All Doctors are kind and caring as well as surgery staff. I will definitely recommend this surgery to all my friends and family for excellent patient care.
Big Thank you.

title: Excellent care
body:
A relative was in Clementine A ward for some weeks during November and December. She received excellent care. I cannot fault the treatment and care given. When bad news had to be explained this was done carefully and the fast track carried out smoothly. In addition the ward was kept clean and sanitised. Despite being busy not one member of staff forgot their correct PPE. For me visiting, they were helpful in all respects. Some of the healthcare assistants didn't always have the best jobs and worked long hours but kept a good sense of humour with no grumbling. 
Well done Clementine A.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Sanang
title: Made comfortable for the Colonoscopy
body: I attended the hospital for this procedure, with a bit of trepidation. However, the nursing team of Natalie, Michelle, Megan & Julie fully explained the procedure and made me as comfortable as possible, for which I thank them.

title: Good patient care ftom a Doctor
body: After almost a week of disappointments with various branches of the medical profession I received excellent customer/patient service from Dr. LYONS. She was new to my brother's case yet, after I had given her a hard time from "a grumpy old man" she dealt with my brother and myself with professionalism, empathy, firmness and humour., for which I thank her.

author: Poppies02
title: Clear explanations
body:
I don't often leave reviews but as this was my second visit to Pilgrim Hospital, again I wanted to say how well looked after I felt, when I had an appointment for a procedure with Mr Mohanty in November 2021.  
On arrival, Mr Mohanty, asked me if I had received a brochure explaining what was going to happen etc but I had just received a letter, so one of the nurses passed me a brochure to read but Mr Mohanty was very kind and explained everything to me. I can't remember the name of the three nurses who looked after me (sorry) but I want to say how kind they were and they really looked after me too, explaining what was going to happen and talking to me to take my mind off the pain. One of the nurses was a student nurse who stayed right next to me and made sure I was feeling okay too. After the procedure Mr Mohanty showed me a picture of my womb and explained what he had done, which was interesting to see. Mr Mohanty and his team are a real credit to the NHS and we're lucky to have them to look after us.

author: Joyful76:
title: Slick & Joined up care
body:
My mum‚Äôs care home found a breast lump and contacted her GP who examined her and referred her to the breast clinic. 2 weeks later I took her to the clinic. We saw an amazing ANP, Elizabeth, today in Gartnavel. Then we had a mammogram and an ultra sound. Mum then had an ultrasound guided biospy. Mum likely has cancer. This is enormously sad but I cannot praise the whole process enough. From start to finish, it was slick and joined up. The staff today were lovely. A big shout out to Barbara the radiologist and the nurse Catriona who put my Mum at ease. My Mum has dementia and they were so good with her. Beyond good, they were kind and thoughtful and super supportive and lovely. Thank you so so much.  
Whatever the future holds, I will always remember your kindness today, it made such a difference.

title: Best Care
body: The staff were very helpful and gave the best care. In spite of being in pain for most of the time in the hospital, they did all they can to keep me informed of every treatment and discussed alternatives based on my condition. Really surprised how calmly they carried out their duties with all the pressure continuous stream of Covid patients coming in continuously. My appreciation goes to you all for your dedication and lives saved.

title: Amazing care
body: I would like to thank all the staff of Sandwell Hospital who looked after me following my recent admission for Covid-related illness.  From the paramedics who brought me in, to the doctors who did the initial work on me in A&E, staff in the AMU and then the day and night staff on Newton 5, thank you so much for your outstanding care.  It is clear that you are really busy and stretched right now in difficult circumstances but you were amazing with me and helping in my recovery.  Everyone was so kind and helpful and made my stay comfortable.  I was well enough to go home after a 5 day stay, and I also received good after care via a follow up phone call.  Thank you everyone at Sandwell, happy new year to all staff.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

author: senga13
title: When i suffered a stroke
body:
I had a stroke in December 2019  
I went to my GP and he confirmed it was a stroke and telephoned the Queen Elizabeth hospital. I feel the care I was given was excellent by staff.  
My consultant was Mr Dawson. He was amazing. I attended the Victoria hospital in February 2020 to see Mr Dawson. He asked me why I was limping with my left leg. I told him it was painful and I thought the limp was due to my stroke. He said it was not connected to my stroke. He sent me that day to get an x-ray on my hip. I am now on the waiting list for a hip replacement. I would like to thank him very much.  
He was exceptional .

author: doradoet35
title: Well impressed
body:
I attended the Inverurie vaccine centre with my husband to get our third boosters yesterday (due to having had covid a month ago we couldn't attend till now. We booked our apps)  
Wanted to say what a great job they did. We got straight in , processed quickly and everyone was polite, friendly and I felt fully informed and looked after. They took time to say hello to my daughter who had to come with me and made her feel welcome too. I know it has at time been busy for them with walk in of large numbers so wanted to take time to say how impressed I was and what a great job they are doing at keeping it all running at this time.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: SC005462
title: Stellar care and treatment
body:
On the evening at the end of December I had a fall in my home and hurt my hip. (Fortunately it wasn't seriously damaged). I was taken by ambulance to the Queen Elizabeth Hospital, where I was examined and had x-rays and eventually was admitted to the ARU overnight. At each stage the care and communications were excellent. The ambulance arrived in good time and the paramedics were skilled and caring.  
In A&E everyone I saw was expert and also pleasant, patient and kind to me. At all times I knew exactly what was happening. They identified themselves and also addressed my by the name I had asked to be called. The same was the case when I was in the ward. I was also impressed by the fact that I was visited by an elderly care nurse (I am 75) who assessed me and my home situation. I live alone and am very independent but found that very reassuring. I was in pain and distress and the whole experience of my contact with your services was very helpful and reassuring. Please accept my compliments.

title: Amazing team
body:
On arrival I was obviously scared, The nursing staff and doctors put me at ease straight away, when it was time to have my procedure I was once again reassured that I will be looked after and I was I can‚Äôt thank cardiology team enough.
Best regards Terence McGeorge

title: Fantastic practice
body: I was made very welcome on the day of my surgery from start to finish was excellent.  All the nursing staff were very kind and understood how you felt and they were very assuring. The doctor I could not see as with drops in my eyes vision was blurred. He had a very calming voice and made me feel at ease, when he had finished he said well done and that pleased me.  I did not feel nervous at all. I would recommend any one with catarats to have this procedure done.  I now wait for my second operation to the other eye. It was quite nice being greeted by a gentleman at the door who took your temperature and asked if you were OK.. Thank you very much.

title: A fantastic practice
body: Since moving to the area in 2020 I've needed to use the surgery a number of times. I've always been able to speak to a doctor the same day, often within a couple of hours, or have been given advice on which day to call to speak to a specific doctor about ongoing medical issues. When I had a miscarriage, my preferred doctor called back within 8 minutes of my phoning the surgery which is incredibly impressive and was very reassuring. I'm really pleased that I found such an excellent surgery to move to, having been with my previous surgery for around 25 years it was a difficult move but this surgery is so much better. Thank you!

title: No staff on any reception desks
body: Went into A&E, was told to come back the next day for a scan. Came back the next day and no staff able to direct us to the correct type of scan. No staff on main reception. No reception desk at the ultra sound.

title: Easy and efficient E consult
body: I have used e consult twice this year. The first one I had a call back the same day from a GP who invited me for a blood test with one of the nurses which showed some anaemia that‚Äôs is now being investigated. I am needle phobic and the nurse was really kind about this and kept me talking throughout. Then last week I did another one not expecting to hear for up to two days and I had a call less than two hours from the duty doctor who prescribed me antibiotics that I was able to start straight away.

title: Brilliant caring service of care
body: My brother has lived at Heatherley for over 25 years and has always been and continues to be well cared for. He has a deteriorating condition, one that staff have managed well. Whenever I visit, I am always greeted with a warm welcome by all staff, and my brother is smart and well kempt.

title: Bad Experience
body:
I telephoned with a general enquiry and the person who answered the phone was unable to help me or transfer me to someone who could do so and exhibited an extremely brusque attitude.
Judging by other people's shared review's, my experience is not uncommon when dealing with Hallamshire Hospital's telephone centre staff.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Stroke
body: A massive massive thank you to all the caring, wonderful, dedicated, professional staff of the stroke unit of Southport Hospital. If not for for them I would have suffered permanent stroke damage. They showed great patience and good humour even though they are under great pressure. Also thanks to CT, MRI, E-Ray and Ambulance teams. The care and the food was of the highest quality. So many names to remember, I only wish I could name them all. A special thanks to my wife who spotted that I was having a stroke and called the ambulance. God Bless you all, and have a quiet happy New Year.

title: Too much pressure
body: My 94 year old mother-in-law was admitted on the 21st December with issues possibly relating to Corona virus.  After a few days she was declare fine and we were waiting for an OT report - now more than a week later we are still awaiting the report and are unable to speak to anyone.  We understand how busy you must be but surely since you had someone ready to go home a week ago in the current situation you would imagine something could be done. She would like to go home, we would like her home, and you would lie to get her bed free.  Very very frustrating

title: Great maternity service on new year's eve
body: At a midwife appointment on 30/12, my wife was told to get an ultrasound. We were very pleased to be given an appointment the very next day, on 31/12. Service was very quick, the scan operator was lovely and we were in and out within the hour. For all the bad mouthing the NHS gets sometimes, this was top notch.

title: Midwife refused to see me and cancelled my‚Ä¶
body: I am very disappointed and feeling bad to write this review.I am 33 weeks pregnant and it is my first pregnancy.Today 31st December 2021 I have an appointment with my midwife but she refuses to see me as i am 20 minutes late for that due to some issues.Me and my husband requested her that we can wait if it was possible but she bluntly rejected our request.I am very disappointed as I am worried sick for my baby's health.moreover she suggested me that I should call the emergency number if i want my routine check up.it felt like she doesn't care about me being a pregnant woman. Highly disappointed.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Superb Practice.
body:
Developed a severe nerve pain just before Christmas. 
Used the e-Consult feature with the assistance of a very helpful receptionist. Have seen a Dr and been phoned by two other Doctors.
X-ray completed and MRI booked. Pain relief prescribed promptly and at designated chemist on same day.
The treatment has been first class from all staff, receptionists and Dr's alike. I would give this surgery 10 out 10.

title: Amazing Staff
body: Amazing & wonderful caring kind staff from when I arrived in the a/e depth & when I stayed in the stroke unit

title: Good practice
body: Great staff- very helpful and polite. As with many other practices, unfortunately, it is often difficult to get through to reception in mornings to book an appointment.

title: Wonderful staff and service
body: I arrived at A&E today Sunday at 11.00 hrs and left at 13.00 hrs , after being checked in/ diagnosed with soft tissue strain of my ankle/ X-ray taken and crutches issued . This was an excellent service , considering it is New Years Eve and staff shortages due to COVID . Each member of staff was courteous, friendly and helpful. I was very impressed and proud that we have the NHS in our life . Well done to all.

title: Awful
body: I requested I Pill Check. Yet I was "told" by reception staff what date "they" have decided I can come to see GP. They also knew intimate details about my previous visit. Surely this information is Private and Confidential? I wish the Doctors and Partners would have more knowledge of how the Reception Staff treat their patients. With contempt.

title: Chaos
body: Didn't seem to be a system for handling / controlling patients. After ECG I was placed in a 'cubicle' to wait, along with someone else. Whilst waiting, two other patients were examined and blood taken from one. After about an hour I was basically asked who I was and what I was doing there. I was asked to sit in reception. On multiple occasions people were called who 5 mins earlier had already been called and entered the treatment room. I can only assume the staff are doing their best but without efficient management. I thank the dept. for the service I received.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful Ambulance Crew
body: I caught Coronavirus over Christmas and had to call for an Ambulance on 30th December. The ambulance arrived within 20 minutes and the crew were so kind and helpful. Having taken my observations they went to great lengths to make certain that I was comfortable and looked after when they had gone. With my permission they asked neighbours to keep an eye out for me. I couldn't be more thankful.

readBy.name: South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor practice
body:
Your Review:  Called the surgery, was told by receptionist I can not speak to GP & to call the following morning, I explained to the receptionist I don‚Äôt have access to a phone all day & expresses the urgency. She stated she will pass on a message. No one has called me the following day as I was unable to make the early morning call. I called again at 11am & I listened to a recording for 20 minutes saying I‚Äôm currently number one in the queue. This was so frustrating. Eventually some one answered & refused to tell me if a Dr was available.. Then the receptionist who took the call insisted I tell her all my details only to tell me the Dr has gone home. 
I‚Äôm disgusted with the the service at jubilee gardens, staff are never helpful, they‚Äôre dismissive & rude. They‚Äôre always late & it‚Äôs very uncomfortable speaking to receptionist who struggle to understand the basics. I also struggle to understand when staff speak to each other in their native tongue, this is unprofessional & offensive. Out of 20 times I call the surgery I have 20 issues. It‚Äôs outrageous & not good enough. The only time I get a call is after I write a review or make a complaint. No one calls regarding the concern i called about. 
No consideration for vulnerable patients or patients less able to get to the surgery, receptionists who clearly have no empathy or compassion for people & an overall lack of concern for patients that are concerned for their well being, leaving patients feeling undervalued & a burden on the NHS. 
This happens all to often & im appalled at the service jubilee gardens has to offer. 
Something has to be done to stop this from happening. 
When I get a call about this review I‚Äôll be promised for the 50th time that this won‚Äôt happen again.

title: Semi prison
body: Stay there for about 10 months, not allowed food when you want, kitchen got a thob key, only staff are allowed. Had to back at 10pm or they lock you out. Staff didnt do much with you. Some staff were nice. Food was Ok. Had to have food at a strict time. Can't have your own bed sheets. The staff seem nice at first but its a front. I got on well with the younger staff than the older staff.

title: Poor reception experience
body: Arrived at A&E on the 30th of December at 6.30 it was very busy.I waited at the window of reception.The receptionist completely ignored me and carried on typing this went on for a few minutes.All the receptionist had to say to me was I am busy I will be with you in a moment she said absolutely nothing and carried typing.I really find this kind of poor service in this day and age very poor customer service.I would recommend your receptionist need re training.I was in A&E for six hours which I am not complaining about I realise the pressure the NHS is under.The care I received from Doctors and nurses was 1st class and would like to thank them for there care.Please don‚Äôt ignore my comments on you receptionist colleague this needs dealing with as I find totally unacceptable.

readBy.name: York Teaching Hospital NHS foundation Trust

title: Absolutely shocking
body: Diagnosed with depression given one course of medication got told would receive a follow up telephone appointment, never got one. A month on after calling them everyday never managing to get through the automated options I gave up, left me struggling no support on mental health what so ever!

title: Amazing during difficult times
body:
My mum is currently in Heartlands on Ward 17 following a fall, fractured femur and subsequent surgery, she is 90.
Despite not being able to visit due to restrictions, everytime I call for an update the ward staff are so friendly and helpful - this is so valuable given we cannot see mum. We delivered supplies to for mum to the ward and a very helpful lady gave us such a detailed overview of mum's progress even though we knew how busy and short-staffed the ward was. I have also used the volunteer service to drop parcels off to mum and again their friendly, helpful service is faultless- what gems to give up their time to provide this support.
My mum has also said how caring the staff are despite how busy and short staffed they are.
Covid is impacting so significantly on everything in society and the fact we take for granted public services should make us stop and think. My mum is not in hospital for covid but the virus is certainly having an impact on the hospital being able to provide care etc.
I cannot fault so far Heartlands Hospital and a so grateful for all the wonderful Nurses, surgeons and auxiliary staff who are looking after my mum when we are unable to visit. Truly amazing. Thank you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Reassuring
body:
Treated by paramedics on 31/12/2021 for shortness of breath and fast heart rate.
Very well looked after.

title: Unacceptable wait times
body:
I am 7 weeks pregnant suffering from severe sickness and unable to keep fluids and food down for over 24 hours. I went to Merlyn vaz out of hours and was referred straight to a&e for an ECG and then to be put on an IV drip for fluids and anti sickness, as my keytones were very high and I was clearly dehydrated as well as having an elevated heart rate.
When I arrived at a&e I gave my ‚Äòurgent‚Äô paperwork to the receptionists and was told it would be hours and hours wait and that my urgent paperwork didn‚Äôt do anything. 
I sat and waited for abit and then left, I felt so unsafe as the a&e was full of drunks.
I still haven‚Äôt had my ecg or my fluids and am just trying to get better at home myself. 
Really feel let down by a&e as all I needed was the ECG and then gyncology would admit me for my IV. Which I explained to the staff and didn‚Äôt really get anywhere. 
I understand that they have a duty of care to treat everyone, but when I have been referred by an out of hours GP I shouldn‚Äôt be left to wait for hours on end.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: waste of time
body: First call to local GPs who were closed. The voicemail advised to call 111. Very helpful person from 111, followed by a call from a 'clinician' who couldn't seem to understand what I was saying, but eventually said an out of hours appointment could be arranged. I had a phone call back from a very helpful, reassuring and understanding person who arranged an appointment immediately. The appointment was with an advanced nurse practitioner, who, it became apparent, was abrupt, lacking any understanding or sympathy, and, ultimately, was not in the slightest bit helpful. This person was happy to talk about their own experience feeling ill, but did not address the actual problem. A complete waste of time.

author: IRVINE@L
title: I've got my life back
body:
I had a total knee replacement at the end of December at the GJNH. From arriving to discharge I cannot thank all the staff at 2west enough. Their care and attention was fantastic. From cleaning staff to nursing staff everyone was superb. All recovery and theatre staff were amazing and made me feel comfortable and at ease. I cannot thank everyone enough.  
I previously had my other knee replaced in May, and feel I have been given my life back.

author: GBrodie
title: Royal hospital for children emergency department
body: Last night (new year) I took my 5 year old son to the emergency department as I was extremely concerned about his general condition from having a virus. I just think this wonderful team deserve recognition for the work they do. The triage nurse, Craig, was outstanding as always. The nurse, Julie, was attentive and reassuring and I really need to mention this wonderful doctor we had called Mr McKenzie (I think that was his name). His care for my son was exceptional and this hasn‚Äôt gone unnoticed. He was warming, caring and left no stone unturned with investigating what was going on with my son. I am an anxious mum as my boy has had quite a start in life but his presence was reassuring. I am so grateful.

author: normatj97
title: Excellent care
body: I would like to thank all the wonderful nurses, doctors, domestics and health care workers at J North for their wonderful care shown to me during my recent admission. I was admitted last year with covid and admitted this year with respiratory conditions. You are all angels. Special thanks to HCSW, Linda, who went above and beyond for every patient. You are all a true asset to the NHS xx

author: Audy29
title: So grateful to them
body: After being unwell for 6 days, I had to phone 111 not long after bells, as my symptoms became worse. My call was answered after about 20 mins (which was surprisingly quick) by efficient and calm call handler, Ian. He then transferred me to the nurse (didn't get her name) she said she would get a clinician to call back within 4 hrs. I was called by a nurse practitioner, Laura, with 25 mins, who was lovely and got me assessed and the treatment I needed. So grateful to them all and especially with the challenges they are facing at this time.

author: NewmumK
title: Amazing maternity experience
body:
I cannot thank or praise the midwives at Inverurie Community Maternity Unit enough for delivering my son and for the exceptional care afterwards. I really wanted a midwife-led birth and hoped to be able to use the birthing pools, so my first choice was AMH if they were available, and if they weren‚Äôt we knew we wanted to go to Inverurie. I still feel like I‚Äôm on such a high after having the most wonderful, positive experience at Inverurie.  
I wasn‚Äôt sure if I was in active labour or not, having not experienced a spontaneous labour with my firstborn, so I went to Inverurie to be greeted by midwife Julie who made us feel so welcome. I expected to be sent home but I was 8cm dilated, so we were taken to one of the birthing rooms straight away where Julie let us both get comfortable. From there Julie encouraged me to follow my instincts and breathe through contractions as long as I could, provided a birthing ball and helped me move into different positions to help baby move down. She was so intuitive, friendly, involved me in all decisions and talked me through everything she was doing, and I felt so comfortable and safe in her presence. The atmosphere was so calm and peaceful, and I would never have believed I could be coached through labour and manage to deliver a baby with no intervention and using gas and air.  
The baby came quickly at the pushing stage and midwife, Jenni, joined us, and although things happened very quickly at that point, there was no panic, things remained so calm. He was delivered and passed to me while still attached to his cord and it was just a magical moment I‚Äôll never forget. We did lots of skin to skin and managed to start breastfeeding before moving into the postnatal room. It was such a lovely place to recuperate and was again so peaceful, and it was so nice to have my husband able to spend as much time with us as possible. I was worried, with covid, that there would be more restrictions on that.  
Our first postnatal midwife visits were from Sophie, who had been my antenatal midwife with my eldest, and it was so lovely to see a familiar, friendly face again. I found all the visits so thorough and reassuring. The midwives scheduled extra calls and even took a panicked call from us on Christmas Day, when we had concerns over our baby‚Äôs vomiting. Jenni extended our midwife care beyond the 10-day discharge which I really appreciated, and also referred us to the infant feeding team at AMH for additional support. Within 24 hours I‚Äôd had a video call and my baby‚Äôs feeding assessed. Karen was so helpful and gave me tips on ways to feed, to help alleviate my baby‚Äôs reflux symptoms. It‚Äôs a brilliant service which I‚Äôd recommend to any new parent who was concerned about feeding.  
The midwife unit at Inverurie is a fantastic facility with a truly wonderful, caring team of midwives. I hope I‚Äôve not missed anyone out (I‚Äôm so sleep deprived and rubbish with names at the best of times!). I just want to say a huge thanks again to Julie and Jenni for looking after us during labour and to Sophie, Julie, Jenni and Lisa for their attentive visits in the days afterwards. And also thanks to the midwives and student midwives I saw during antenatal appointments, we think you are all amazing.

author: IUD user
title: Removal and new IUD
body:
Easy to arrange appointment in advance for procedure.  
Welcoming from start. Nurse and Dr made me feel comfortable. Talked through what would happen and frequently checked that I was ok.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust o

title: Chasing your own CT scans up
body: Not good chasing up CT scans and they know nothing about, so have to waite another week to see what they are doing, when it was referred to them by another hospital. Not had best experience from start of my diagnosis.

title: Cataract surgery
body: I received excellent service from the first phone call from SpaMedica to book me in for pre op checks to the actual operation. The staff at Wokingham branch were extremely friendly and I cannot fault the assistance I received highly recommended.

title: General Tests and Diabities Care
body: Alwasy been impressed with the nurses at Berryfields Medocial Centre, so much so that I now actually quite like to be seen by individuals here. Friendly staff in the centre and quick results available through the NHS App.

title: Receptionists leave a bad taste in patients'‚Ä¶
body:
I have family that has gone to this practice for >5 years and I decided to finally sign up when I moved to London. I unfortunately had the misfortune of engaging with two receptionists that seemed hostile.

The nurses are professional and absolutely kind. I understand being jaded by your work and that working with people is high pressure, but I wouldn't recommend the Phoenix Practice to anyone based on this unpleasant first encounter.

title: Unfriendly Reception Staff
body: Cannot fault the care given by the nursing team however let down by the reception team. The tone and welcome from the reception team leaves a lot to be desired . Understand there is covid and the stress this causes but talking to adult like children is not acceptable !

title: Simply fantastic
body: I was admitted after having an accident iceskatung just before Christmas . Minor Injury department were lovely, very kind and thorough as we're the xray team. I had actually broken my ankle very badly and was immediately admitted to Thomas ward and basically straight into theatre.  The anaesthetist was very calm and so were all of the medical team operating on me. Even on waking, the porter was kind and cheerful when taking g me back to the ward. Every single nurse and staff member on Thimas ward was wonderful, attentive,kind and caring. I also tested positive for Covid and so was in isolation,  the nurses never moaned knee about having to wear PPE gear to see me and even in the middle of the night came in to chat and check up on me. Despite it being Christmas and all staff having to work and miss family events and parties, everyone was so cheerful  and kind. If I was to say one thing I learned about Warwick hospital it's that Kindness lives here,everywhere you look.

title: Can't imagine anywhere better
body:
Was on the site looking to see when the surgery opens after New Year and didn't know you could leave reviews.
My family have been coming here more than 40 years so we can't compare with other GPs but have never thought to. There's just the two of us oldies now, the birds having flown the nest, and every experience we've had has in every way been everything we would hope for. Over the years some of the doctors, nurses and reception staff have changed but the standard of attention, care and expertise has been consistent, so they know how to find replacements. Happy New Year to you all and long may your lumb reek as our Scottish relatives say.

title: Lovely staff
body:
Attended A + E on Christmas Day with a fractured wrist.
Seen really quickly.
Staff lovely.
Thank you.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Just wanted to say a massive thank you to all of the staff this year for being extremely helpful, polite and very professional for all 3 of my covid vaccines. The whole process has been organised perfectly, it‚Äôs greatly appreciated not just by myself but also by the majority of the community.

title: Great practice
body: Just wanted to say a massive thank you to all of the staff this year for being extremely helpful, polite and very professional for all 3 of my covid vaccines. The whole process has been organised perfectly, it‚Äôs greatly appreciated not just by myself but also by the majority of the community.

title: Thank you
body:
On December 17th our mum was admitted to ward 6 from A&E for palliative care. 
Even with COVID restrictions I was able to stay with her on the ward and therefore be with her for her final days.
To lose someone at this time of year is incredibly sad but the care both she and I received was exceptional.
All the staff on the ward treated us both with so much kindness.
One staff nurse, whom I‚Äôm not allowed to name, went far above and beyond and we will always be so grateful to her. I will always remember you and more so when I‚Äôm driving home to Yorkshire on the A1.

Thank you ward 6
Thank you South Tyneside Hospital.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Injection
body: Thank you for sorting out my pneumonia jab out so quickly in less than 2 days all via text and over the Christmas period. Cheers.

title: Really helpful and quick
body: Lovely staff, very professional and efficient. Would recommend as an alternative to A&E for urgent care.

title: Kind and efficient care of an eye injury
body: I phoned 111 as I was having issues with my eye caused by a nasty scratch, it was extremely painful and as nothing else was open due to the holidays, I was sent to A+E. I was very aware my injury was not life threatening and was happy to wait, but I only had to wait an hour and a kind nurse took me round to have my eye treated to save me waiting. The doctor who saw me was friendly and explained everything he was doing- my scratch is now on the mend and I am very reassured. Thank you for all your help, I know how much pressure you are all under.

title: Excellent level of care
body: I requested a telephone appointment on the 31st Dec,as I felt it‚Äôd be difficult to obtain a face to face under the current climate. My GP arranged a face to face appointment straightaway over the phone which was necessary as I had an earache and examined my ear at the appointment. He is very considerate, caring, courteous and has all the virtues  as a GP & a human being you can think of. Even though the surgery might have the odd shortcoming as any other, but providing excellent care is their forte. Thank you Herschel.üòä

title: Excellent Treatment
body: I visited the Same Day Surgical Assessment Dept following a referral by the 111 service.  I had been staying with relatives and was taken poorly and even though it was a Bank Holiday - my treatment was excellent with a CT scan arranged that same day.

title: Excellent service and treatment
body:
I attended the Day Surgery Centre for an ear operation on the 31 December 2021. Everything relating to the operation was handled exceptionally well by ENT and associated departments (e.g. regular cleaning out of ear in the ENT Department prior to the operation and discussions with the ENT consultant; arrangements for a CT Scan and Hearing Test, the pre-assessment process, the Covid swab test and communications about the actual processes at the Day Surgery Centre). I was contacted by the Day Surgery Centre on the day before the operation to check that I was ok and that I understood, for example, the starvation instructions that I needed to follow prior to the operation. What was particularly impressive was the fact that the person making the call put me at ease immediately by saying that there was nothing to worry about. This was important because, after having my covid swab test a few days earlier, when the phone rang I was concerned that it may be a call in relation to my covid test.

On the day of my operation, the procedures in the Day Surgery Centre were handled exceptionally well. The tests undertaken by the nurses, the discussions with the ENT surgeon and the Anaesthetist, the continuous checks to make sure that processes were being followed correctly and the discussions with the theatre staff on the way down to the operating theatre and the way that the anaesthetist and the team put me at ease as they administered the anaesthetic. 

After the operation, the staff in the recovery room were excellent with their caring nature that involved regular checks and conversations to ensure that everything was going well in terms of the recovery process. The ENT surgeon came to see me to let me know the outcome of the operation and what would happen going forward. The discharge nurse then took me to the recovery lounge, took my cannula out, continuously checked that I was ok and then contacted my relative to come and pick me up. I then left the Day Surgery Centre with all my discharge information including a letter from the ENT Surgeon which would also be sent to my GP.

In summary, I must say that the internal supply chain that supported me during the different stages of having my operation were excellent in every respect. I would like to sincerely thank all of the NHS staff involved in this process.

readBy.name: Sarah Champion's Office, MP for Rotherham

title: Excellent service
body:
Visited A@E with our very nervous 3 year old boy with a poorly arm, within 20 minutes of  arrival we were seen by paediatrics, who were fantastic and sent on our way.  Thoughtful, caring and comforting to me and my child. So much so he said he had a poorly head on the journey home and told us to go back to see the nurse!

Fantastic experience, thanks for all your hard work.

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Rude and unhelpful reception
body: I went to collect urgent paperwork which GP confirmed that it was ready. But the the receptionist was arguing that it is not ready and didn't even bother to stand up from her chair to check. When my colleague came after me and firmly explained the situation, in the beginning, the receptionist was rude and argumentative however one of her co-workers turned up and said it was ready and took the envelope from the reception desk üôÑ. You can imagine how helpful the reception was

title: West Middlesex Hospital - disgraceful
body:
My husband who is 87 years old  was taken to hospital at around 4:30pm I was not allowed to go with him because of COVID., which is understandable.  However, it is 23:31 and no one has contacted me to tell me whether he has been admmited to hospital or not.  Not only disgraceful and unnaceptable.

I am concerned called the hospital they gave me the number for A&E but no one replies.  I can appreciate that they may be busy but hanging up without even replying is completely wrong.  How can I sleep if no one tells me exactly where he isand whether he has been admmited to hospital?  

Do not allow a 86 years old to be accompanied by his wife who was double vaccinated and received a booster and also had a recent test proving no presence of the virus it is not acceptable, actually completely, wrong.

It is much more than bad and incimprehensible.

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Not sure how to feel
body: Using the 111 and therefore this service so not clog 999, called due to my 11 week old daughter not seeing herself and her breathing consistently having fast episodes and was good I would get a call from a doctor with an hour‚Ä¶it‚Äôs currently been 3 and still waiting

title: Very good practice
body:
Great Staff
Perfect people in the right place 
I was hospitalized from 10 to 24 Dec 2021 at EDEN WARD 
Doctors and nurses are wonderful people with very strong professionalism 
I have to thank all of you forever

title: Horrendous service and communication
body:
On Friday 31st December 2021, after waiting for nearly 15 minutes to get through to reception about receiving a call from the doctor, when I finally got through, I was told the GP would call me at 10:45 on Sunday 2nd January 2022. 

I received 3 missed calls from the GP at 08:47, 08:47 and 08:52. This is not the time that was stated on Friday. This is not the first time Star Lane have decided to call me out of the time that was stated.

On the voicemail, the doctor said I would now have to book it online AGAIN! What is the point of stating a time for an appointment if the GP will completely ignore it over and over again. This is ridiculous service.

It's diabolical that you cannot book appointment via the phone. Even if you do, it takes at least 2 days for the GP to get back to you. Furthermore, even if you state the time, they'll disregard it anyway.

With the Bank Holiday being on Monday, that means I won't be able contact them until Tuesday. It will take them 2 days get back to me, taking me to the end of the week.

I have had this medical problem since the end of August and Star Lane have refused to take me seriously and keep putting seeing me in person. The last time I had this issue I stated the fault with having an online form if it keeps being ignored, unsurprisingly, Star Lane didn't take notice.

Star Lane's service needs to improve greatly, their horrendous communication and service will put people continuously at risk! Please avoid them if you value your health.

title: Absolutely wonderful and caring
body: I have attended this hospital for three stays during 2020 and 2021 for kidney stone removal. I spent time in critical care and Dilham wards and found the behaviour of staff under pressure was exemplary. I was treated with kindness and care to a high level I could not have imagined. The urology surgeons are also to be highly commended. I could not have received better treatment if I had been royalty. Money can pay for the NHS but no amount of money can pay for the care and kindness from staff from surgeons to HCAs and cleaners and the levels in between.

title: Bad service
body: I went to the gp to get face to face appointments for my grandchildren as their issues need to be face to face due to being looked after children, I am not having video appointments it's my human right to see a Dr face to face should I need it this surgery should be ashamed of themselves I will never ever recommend this surgery to anyone ever

title: A Big Thank You!
body: I have received the most wonderful care and attention during my recent visit to A&E and the SDEC Department within the AMU. The staff were so caring through a series of tests and although the number of patients never stoped arriving, they worked calmly and treated everyone with great respect. I send my sincere thanks to the doctors, nurses, porters and everyone who helped me that night. Wishing you all a calmer and less crazy New Year.

title: Excellent Manager / Doctor
body: The manager and the doctor were excellent at solving my mums issues, and very fast. I hope all the other surgeries follows their example. This practice works for the patients and not to their bottom line !

title: Exceptional Practice
body: we have been with this practice for over 55 years my husband all his life and always valued it highly..  The professionalism, care, kindness and support given is outstanding.  The only difference Covid has made is not always seeing the person you are talking to.  The Triage system is so much less wasteful of time and we know if it is urgent it will be dealt with, my husband has been seen within hours and admitted to Airedale as speedily.  They are always keen to help and have forged an outstanding work practice and ethic. We are very very lucky.

title: Four separate tests
body:
I have underwent four separate tests during three visits to the hospital the in the past week. At all stages I found the staff to be extremely efficient, professional, friendly and helpful. 
Very professional and stress free experiences at all appointments.

title: Excellent practice
body:
My husband and I are so grateful for the care and attention given to us both since we  have been registered with this practice, over nine years.

We have seen several different doctors, our request is usually met on the day and each time we have been happy with the outcome.

Thank you so much for the wonderful care and treatment received.

The receptionists and nurses when called upon have been so helpful too.

title: Very good practice in extraordinary and difficult‚Ä¶
body:
The NHS as a whole has been put under considerable pressure over the last two years and Holmwood have certainly stepped up to the plate.
The clinicians and nurses have always been available wether by phone, or in person if needed. My self and family members have been afforded face to face appointments when necessar throughout the pandemic They have been, as always,  caring, interested and friendly. Of particular note is the sterling work they have put in to the vaccination of  the wider community 
I for one truly value this practice and all their dedication and hard work . Thank you all at Holmwood  .

title: Fantastic Service, Amazing Staff
body: I was unfortunate enough to spend New Year's Eve in hospital having surgery to my wrist. This experience was made as pleasant as it could possibly be by the outstanding service and compassionate care I received from the wonderful orthopaedic team, the surgeon, and theatre staff, particularly the anaesthetist  and theatre nurse who really put me at ease, and the lovely staff on ward D7, all of whom introduced themselves but I am not allowed to state names, sorry. Thank you.

title: helpful, quick
body: Had been a patient for three years while studying in Leeds. Originally you would queue up for a same day appointment which was okay really if you had uni to go to afterwards but if not it did take time out of your day. Due to Covid they are now using eConsult which allows you to fill in information online which is then sent to the practice to review and give an appointment. This means no same day appointments but you do hear back by the end of the next day. The staff are friendly and helpful over the phone and put you in the right direction for what you need and the doctors are really helpful too. I've had practices before that would see you waiting 4 weeks for an appointment so compared this one is really good.

title: Really positive Smear experience
body: I was very nervous to have my Smear test done as it was my first since having had a baby, and I had a difficult birth. The nurse was calming, reassuring, thanked me for coming to my appointment despite being anxious and talked me through everything. It was a really quite pleasant experience given what the procedure was! I cannot thank the nurse who saw me enough, I had been dreading it but the whole experience was a relief.

title: No call back‚Ä¶ 4 year old with temperature 40.4!!
body: My 4 year son has had temperatures for 2 days after hitting the 40 I rang to be seen. Explained he has had negative Covid results was told I would get a call from a GP within 2 hours. It‚Äôs now 7 hours later plus the 1 hour 15mins to get through!!!! I am a paediatric nurse and the last thing we would want is for young children to be exposed to a&e infections hence the 111 service! I am appalled

title: Amazing inpatient experience
body: I recently have a craniotomy at Royal preston due to a tunour being found , now at beginning of the process as an outpatient under neurology my care wasn't exceptional to be honest, I was disappointed as an outpatient but saying this the staff are under immense pressure and when actually seeing them they were lovely face to face its just difficult to have neuro review over the phone , however once referred to neurosurgical team my care was outstanding , the surgeon had me in for an appointment very quickly and booked me in for surgery as soon as his appointments allowed, I sadly fell poorly so had to change surgery dates , and the waiting list team were so kind and friendly , as well as my surgeon and his team.. once admitted under the DOSAA unit I deal with some caring nurses and HCAs they were so lovely , I I had a chat with with aneasthatist who was amazing !! And truly put me at ease , My consultant and his registrar went above and beyond their job roles and I'm so thankful for them the Odp who collected me was so kind , I don't remember the surgery due to being asleep but upon waking in the PACU unit I have the utmost respect for the amount of care and compassion and friendliness I received there ! Every nurse was brilliant and the doctor who had to check on me due to Nystagmus was wonderful I felt safe and at ease ( which is difficult due to working in the hospital I hate being there as a patient ) I then was admitted to the neurosurgical ward 2c where again my care was absolutely outstanding, due to the pressures they would have been short staffed but you would never had noticed , they were always checking on me  , I was even told off due to being too independent haha, I dealt with wonderful nurses , HCAs and a fantastic student nurse who the trust is lucky to have .. my blood pressure dropped in the night and they were constantly monitoring and giving me fluids , at the end I dealt with an physiotherapist, occupational therapist and some other specialists to ensure I was safe to go home and again they were wonderful , the only part of my care which I would say I didn't 100 percent agree with was once I was able to be discharged I was sent to the discharge lounge where it was absolutely full ! Like no chairs available so sat with 3 different people at a table and didn't feel very covid safe but again I understand sue to pressured and need of the beds .. despite this I would still hundred prevent recommend royal preston for care , and I'm so thankful for all the staff members I came in contact with , including cleaners ,porters ,chefs ,absolutely everyone.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Rude reception staff
body: The reception staff is very rude. They don't listen to the issues and always put forward their say rudely. They need to be sympathetic to the patients. We have the right to be treated well when we call or visit for the health problem.

author: PCR tests
title: A incident that occurred at the QueensPEC test centre
body:
I am writing to bring to your attention and incident that occured when both my wife wnd I went for PCR tests in the Queens Physical Education Centre PEC.  
At that time we were both sick with covid and we felt awful.  
I feel so strongly that writing to you to highlight an incident that has traumatised my wife & I.  
We felt that we were addressed really aggressively by one of the QUB PEC testing centre staff and when we called them out on it they made a big scene, got their supervisor who immediately defended them on the basis they'd worked together for years. Both failed to understand that we weren't calling the member of staff out on what they said, but how they said it. In our opinion, their tone was aggressive, short, clipped and dismissive. We were trapped in a cubicle, everyone could hear and most could see. I had to beg them in tears to scan our tests and let us leave. I had to walk past everyone only to have the original staff member tell my husband to have a nice day, which we felt they did so sarcastically.  
We left only to have the supervisor follow us outside asking what was wrong with the member of staff wishing us a nice day. All I could do was turn around and ask why they were following us whilst still in tears.  
I have nothing but the highest regard for our frontline health workers but in my 46 years but I don't think I've ever felt so humiliated and vulnerable in my life.

author: Schr√∂dinger's cat
title: Lengthy wait for biopsy results
body:
I had gastroscopy and colonoscopy taken 8 weeks ago where numerous biopsies were taken. I was advised results would take between 4 -6 weeks, nursing staff informed me if i hadn‚Äôt heard within 6 weeks to call GP. At 6 weeks called but no results, at 8 weeks I called my GP again to ask about results but results still pending. Called hospital but receptionist told me my results would go straight to GP as i was not attached to any hospital consultant.  
Whilst I appreciate the pressures the NHS is currently experiencing I am growing increasingly worried about results, but no news is good news‚Äù right? I am curious as to how long I have to wait as I keep getting told ‚Äú6 weeks is a guideline‚Äù.

author: HifBaig
title: Staff member at Harris birth right centre
body:
I went in for my 34 weeks scan and was forced to take part in their research. I was reluctant and said no many times but I felt the staff pushed me until I said yes. I however mentioned I will not be able to wait for the results.  
My scan was done by a lovely staff member who was kind and explained everything while they were doing it, and they apologised when they had to press too hard.  
Then came the other staff to perform their research bit. This member of staff did not explain what they were going to do and put a tight strap across my neck, I touched it to adjust so I could breath and they snapped at me to not touch it as it costs ¬£20k. It was so awkward that I just laughed a little to make the situation normal but this member of staff told me not to laugh because it wasn't funny. I was so put off and upset and just wanted to end the whole thing then and there and walk off but I calmed myself down but their rude behaviour continued. My eyes were shut and the member of staff was scanning them and telling me to stop moving your eyes so much. How the hell do I have control over them when they are shut and you are pushing on my eyelids?  
Furthermore, during the testing I was told a few times to hold my breath at almost 35 weeks pregnant!  
In the end I was told by the same rude staff that all my readings were high, my bp was high so chances are I will have the condition they were researching for which was quite shocking to me. They refused to give me a copy of my scan which I had to force them for because I needed it for my midwife appointment.  
We waited outside and the other staff came to give me my report and I asked them if my BP was high (all through my pregnancy my bp has been on the lower side) and they informed me it was normal!  
In my opinion the attitude of this staff member was rude and I felt like what I'd been misinformed, It made me feel awful and worried me for no reason. I am so upset and want never to see this staff member again. They also were wearing their mask on their chin when there were 4 people in a small room with me being vulnerable due to pregnancy.  
I feel like they need training in how to talk to people and basic manners.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Hillside1
title: Discharged home with lack of support
body:
A close relative was admitted to ward 102 after a fall at home via two amazing paramedics. In her 80‚Äôs the doctor and nursing staff said she wouldn‚Äôt be discharged home until safe to do so (before this fall she was totally independent with a walking stick)  
Unfortunately after 24 hours she was discharged home , with no support. She was unable to mobilise without a Zimmer frame in the hospital however was sent home without one. She needed close supervision as unable to get in/out of bed and discharged with two large infected wounds to her knees which now requires district nurse and GP input.  
As a family we have had to provide 24/7 care and support to her so she could stay at home and have had to alert the GP to get the nurses and arrange for OT and physio assessments to be done at her house .  
Very disappointing and hope we never have to deal with ward 102 again after this admission and both nurses and medical staff for listening to the patient‚Äôs or family‚Äôs concerns.

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West
Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: SJC123
title: Patients with dementia not treated with compassion
body:
If you shout at someone with dementia to shut up there are people dying here, because they‚Äôre shouting out in fear, then they and the other people with dementia will think they are the ones dying. No matter how bad the situation is currently in the NHS, there‚Äôs no excuse for saying such a nasty comment to my relative.  
The staff at Pilgrim Hospital do not seem to help feed the patients who need feeding. Nurses and support staff do this at other hospitals, so that patients don‚Äôt starve. Instead at Pilgrim, I have seen food placed in front of patients, and taken away if the food is left. This is such a wicked thing to do. How can a patient who can‚Äôt feed themselves sit looking at food and have it taken away? It is a heartless thing to do.

author: sextanshh75
title: Disappointment for Virtual visit
body:
Feeling extremely disappointed. Phone call left us Feeling distressed, added to feelings of helplessness and emphasised how vulnerable and lonely the patient must feel.  
In my opinion, video calls are unsuitable for the technologically illiterate, leading to confusion and complete lack of engagement.  
I feel if the named visitor is triple vaccinated, can provide evidence of a negative test result and is attired in the appropriate p.p.e. A face to face visit would be reassuring for both parties.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: KCN9
title: Poor Patient experience
body: Awful inpatient experience, from my opinion staff uncaring and no emotional support offered at the worst time of my life. Left in waiting room for hours without seeing any staff despite awaiting an emergency operation. Nurses ignored my crying/sobbing. One nurse even laughed at me when i asked through tears when my medication would be ready so i could go home. I was told i would need a scan in 8 weeks, it has now been 8 weeks and i have had no appointment. Do not know who to contact to chase this. This only a small snippet of the complaints i have.

author: loveqf83
title: Virtual call
body: Great idea but my mother lives on the border in an area where there is an horrendous signal. The call was a nightmare and we were on for about 1 minute and lost connection. My mother is 80 years old and was left upset. As for my father who has dementia, it was his first experience of this type of call and he was so confused and agitated by it all. It certainly didn't suit for my dad and mum. I feel that a phone call would be best. The nurse said we can't phone to speak with him as they are too busy. What is wrong with wearing full protective clothing, having lateral flow and visiting for 30 mins? I mean, a very very sick 81 year old with dementia deserves better. I think these blanket bans are horrendous.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Padster
title: A&E doctor Hairmyres
body: I have a history of heart issues and high blood pressure plus angina. I also have STV and an irregular heart beat. I‚Äôm in my 50‚Äôs. Presented to A&E in April 2021 with angina, as advised by NHS direct. The duty A&E doctor was rude and dismissive towards me. They kept saying I wasn‚Äôt having a heart attack and I was wasting their time being at A&E. They also advised I was to stop taking my Beta blockers. 5 month later I took a heart attack and a stroke.

author: Foster carer
title: Covid Test
body: Very badly signposted and organised. After going to 3 different parts of the hospital, a passing nurse told us where to park. They thought someone would come out to us there. We sat at the entrance for 10 minutes. There were other cars gathering too. My husband had to get out of the car and approach a staff member, who had been sitting in their car watching us, but never approached us at the waiting point. They worked there and told us we were late. They said they had tried to call us. No missed calls on my phone. I was told that no one would have booked an appointment for 11. Waited 25 mins before a nurse appeared. Screaming 18 month old and a nervous 9 year old. The nurse who swabbed my 9 year old was lovely. But I felt the rest was a complete shambles.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: SarahBeara
title: Paediatric Care
body:
My son had been suffering with a fever for 15 days (triggered by an initial chest infection then tonsillitis) before we were referred by our GP to ward 19 for further investigation. Upon entry to Ward 19, I felt the doctor who reviewed my son had no interest in my son or what my GP had referred us up for. They attempted to send us home without any support whatsoever. However, I advocated strongly for my son (which I shouldn't have to do) and was able to ensure he had blood tests done. His tests came back showing elevated levels of infection, which we were aware of from his severe tonsillitis. The doctor discharged us with no further support and my son still having a high temperature.  
The following day my son's condition had deteriorated and he was extremely lethargic, temperature above 40 degrees and he was in considerable pain. I took him back to ward 19 where the doctor admitted us to ward 20 and started IV antibiotics.  
IV antibiotics are supposed to be given every 6 hours. However, they decided to ignore the 6 hour timescale and move his next dose to midnight, as this suited the routine on the ward. Midnight came and went and nobody appeared to administer my son's IV antibiotics that were already 3 hours late. My husband asked for somebody to administer his antibiotics at soon after this and nobody appeared until an hour later - now 4 hours past when his antibiotics were due.  
At this point, the nurse claimed that the cannula wasn't working and that a doctor would be required for them to proceed further. My son was not seen by a doctor until after 2 hours later, now 12 hours past his initial dose of IV antibiotics and 6 hours beyond when a dose was due.  
The doctor that we had initially seen in ward 19 on the first day attempted to place a cannula on a sleeping 3 year old, not once, not twice but four attempts, all of which failed. My son, as you can imagine, became incredibly distressed and at this stage my husband had to tell them to stop. He was given a dose of oral antibiotics and we were told they would be back in the morning and they would reassess for a cannula 4 hours after this.  
There was clear medical need for IV antibiotics, hence the admission and prescription being made. However, they decided not to proceed with an IV due to the fact that it had been 24 hours since his first dose.  
I found this an absolutely shambolic and traumatising event for my son which seemed to place convenience for staff workload over the basic needs of their patients. I feel they jeopardised my son's health and safety and showed no regard for his mental health and wellbeing. This is a shocking state of affairs for any ward, never mind a paediatric ward where patients are unable to advocate for themselves.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Very helpful support for my mother
body: Despite the burden of COVID the surgery has always returned scheduled calls within the agreed time window & follow up appointments with other agencies have been prompt.   The advice & support provided during the calls has been very helpful.

title: Wonderful Health Care provision!
body: As a result of a visit to the surgery, my GP needed to organise referrals to the hospital, for a number of different issues (some unknown to me at that time). They took the time to explain the timeframe of the various examinations and consultations, etc. I remain most grateful to them for their dedication in picking these up, the attention to detail throughout, their patience, and lovely patient care, and, for expediting the process to begin that day. Thank you so very much.

title: Great service
body:
I would just like to thank all medical staff and security at RVI A&E Newcastle. My daughter has received excellent care on numerous occasions relating to mental health and self harm issues. Also thanks to the staff on ward 46 who helped her and treated her very well in her latest admission to endoscopy service.
All staff are courteous and professional and friendly which is always a great relief to me as a mother. Unfortunately this is a very serious mental health condition with repeated visits/admissions.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care
body: I was seen by a youthful Registrar, who was professional at all times and who took great care to communicate with me at all times. The examination was gentle and thorough. I learned a lot about my body. The Registrar drew me a diagram, which was a nice touch. I told her I'd get it framed and sell it on an artist's website. Thanks to this professional, I have also identified a need for HRT, which will probably have a great impact on my well being.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
